Package nl.rug.aoop.asteroids.gameobserver

Class ObservableGame

java.lang.Object
nl.rug.aoop.asteroids.gameobserver.ObservableGame
Direct Known Subclasses:
Game
public abstract class ObservableGame extends Object
An observable game is an object that game update listeners can register to, so that when the game updates, they will be able to react to it.

Since Java has deprecated the official Observable and Observer objects, this class serves as a custom implementation of the Observable class that is suited to the uses of this game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Modifier
    Constructor

    protected
    ObservableGame()
    Constructs a new observable game with initially no listeners.

    Tells all the registered listeners that their representation of the game should be updated.

  • Method Details

    • addListener

      public void addListener​(GameUpdateListener listener)
      Adds the given listener to the list of listeners that will get notified when the game updates.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to add.

    • notifyListeners

      public void notifyListeners​(long timeSinceLastTick)
      Tells all the registered listeners that their representation of the game should be updated.
      Parameters:
      timeSinceLastTick - The number of milliseconds that have passed since the last game tick occurred. This is used so that things like a display may continue showing an animated model while no actual physics update has been done by the game engine.
